sentences.english: It was a reasonable explanation, but his voice lacked conviction .
sentences.chinese: 这解释合情合理，只是他的语气不坚定。

sentences.english: It took her so much effort to speak that what she said carried great conviction (= showed she felt sure of what she said ) .
sentences.chinese: 她费了很大的劲在说，因此说出来的话显得很确定。

sentences.english: They had no previous convictions.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有前科。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sure about something and having no doubts

name: bound
trans: 一定会发生的, 必定的

sentences.english: Don’t lie to her. She’s bound to find out.
sentences.chinese: 别骗她，她肯定会发现的。

sentences.english: When you are dealing with so many patients, mistakes are bound to happen.
sentences.chinese: 你要照顾这么多病人，失误在所难免。

detailed_translations.english: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

sentences.english: a bleak January afternoon
sentences.chinese: 一月里一个阴冷的下午

sentences.english: The landscape was bleak.
sentences.chinese: 景色一片凄凉。

detailed_translations.english: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

sentences.english: They’ve been guzzling beer all evening.
sentences.chinese: 他们整个晚上都在狂饮啤酒。

detailed_translations.english: to eat or drink a lot of something, eagerly and quickly – usually showing disapproval

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

sentences.english: ...low-paid menial jobs, such as cleaning and domestic work.
sentences.chinese: …工钱少又卑微的工作，诸如打扫清洁或做家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 卑微的；仆人的；适合仆人做的
detailed_translations.english: Menial work is very boring, and the people who do it have a low status and are usually badly paid

detailed_translations.chinese: 仆人；住家佣工；下贱的人

name: somewhat
trans: 多少有点, 在某种程度上

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

name: fervent
trans: 热情的, 强烈的, 炎热的,热心的

sentences.english: a fervent appeal for peace
sentences.chinese: 对和平的强烈呼吁

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的；强烈的；炽热的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

name: artificial
trans: 人造的, 仿造的, 虚伪的

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: perception
trans: 知觉, 领悟力, 感觉

sentences.english: And when they do, what do you think their perception will be?
sentences.chinese: 当他们这样做时，你觉得他们的知觉是怎样的？

detailed_translations.english: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing
to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

name: reshape
trans: 改造...的形状,改变...的结构

sentences.english: If they succeed, then they will have reshaped the political and economic map of the world.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们获得成功，他们将会改变世界的政治和经济格局。

sentences.english: the infancy of radio broadcasting
sentences.chinese: 无线电广播的初期阶段

detailed_translations.english: the period of a child’s life before they can walk or talk

sentences.english: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
sentences.chinese: 他能模仿所有老师的口音。

sentences.english: ‘I’m so sorry,’ she mimicked.
sentences.chinese: “很抱歉。”她学着说道。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 效颦者，模仿者；仿制品；小丑

name: sentient
trans: 有感觉力的, 感觉灵敏的, 有感情的

sentences.english: Man is a sentient being.
sentences.chinese: 人是有感知力的生命。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有感情的；有感觉力的；意识到的
detailed_translations.english: able to experience things through your senses

sentences.english: The charlatan boasted that he could charm off any disease.
sentences.chinese: 这个江湖骗子吹牛说他能用符咒治好各种疾病。

sentences.english: Incapable of moral clarity, he could never quite admit to himself that he was a charlatan and that his scheme was an impossible fiasco.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏明确的道德准则，他从来不承认自己是一个江湖骗子以及他的计划是个彻底的失败品。

sentences.english: If you are too trusting of the invisible, then you buy that $89 ebook that comes with the promise of instant riches, or you sign up for ear candling, or invest time and money with a charlatan.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对这些无形的事物相当信任，那么你可能会花89美元买一个承诺给你一夜暴富的电子书，或报名参加一次耳烛疗法，或跟一个江湖郎中花费你的时间和金钱。

name: imitate
trans: i模仿(某人的言谈﹑ 举止﹑ 衣着等)

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: the smell of rotten eggs
sentences.chinese: 坏鸡蛋的气味

sentences.english: Some of the wood was completely rotten.
sentences.chinese: 有些木头完全腐烂了。

sentences.english: The apples went rotten very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 苹果很快就腐烂了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐烂的；堕落的；恶臭的；虚弱的；极坏的
detailed_translations.english: badly decayed and no longer good to use

sentences.english: My ideal is to be an astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.english: If people know you’re an astronomer, they will soon be asking you all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.english: Any astronomer, at any university, in any country can write a proposal for what they want to do with the telescope.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies the stars and  planet s

name: anthropomorphic
trans: 拟人的(将神或动物看作具有人格的)

sentences.english: “This is what policy makers want to hear, ” he said. ”If you focus on doomsday statements, you will lose them.
sentences.chinese: “这才是政策制定者想听的”他说，“如果你把焦点放在描述世界末日上，你就会失去他们。

sentences.english: Does all of this add up to a doomsday scenario, with the threat having shifted from a US slowdown to food inflation?
sentences.chinese: 是否所有这一切都添加到世界末日的情况，在这个征兆下，转向从美国放缓的食物通货膨胀？

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界末日；最后的审判日
detailed_translations.english: In the Christian religion, Doomsday is the last day of the world, on which God will judge everyone

sentences.english: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.chinese: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

detailed_translations.chinese: [安全] 保护；保卫；保护措施
detailed_translations.english: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems
to protect something from harm or damage

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: privacy
trans: 独处或不受干扰的状况,隐私,隐居

sentences.english: each individual’s right to privacy
sentences.chinese: 每个人的隐私权

detailed_translations.english: the state of being free from public attention

sentences.english: Clarence Page is a columnist for the Chicago Tribune.
sentences.chinese: 克拉伦斯·佩奇是《芝加哥论坛报》的专栏记者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes articles, especially about a particular subject, that appear regularly in a newspaper or magazine

name: paparazzo
trans: 专门追逐名人的摄影记者, 狗仔队

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

name: pitch
trans: 为...作宣传, 替...说好话

sentences.english: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她把那页纸揉成团，扔进了火里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投掷， 扔； 猛然倒下； (船、 飞机)颠簸
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 球场；程度，强度；高度，高音；沥青；顶点
detailed_translations.english: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

detailed_translations.chinese: 销售；投掷，扔；使猛然倒下；表达；把…定于特定程度；定调；架设，搭，营
detailed_translations.english: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

name: script
trans: 剧本, 脚本, 讲稿

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: cruelty
trans: 残暴; 残忍; 残酷

sentences.english: The children had suffered cruelty and neglect.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子遭受虐待，无人照管。

sentences.english: There was a hint of cruelty in Brian’s smile.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩的微笑里流露出一丝残暴。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

sentences.english: Health officials have tried to raise awareness (=  improve people’s knowledge  ) about AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 卫生部官员努力提高人们对艾滋病的认识。

detailed_translations.english: knowledge or understanding of a particular subject or situation

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

sentences.english: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 30 leading U.S. destinations.
sentences.chinese: …每天飞往美国30个主要目的地的100多个国内航班。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

sentences.english: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们挥舞着旗帜，欢迎俄罗斯领导人。

sentences.english: the flag of Kenya
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚国旗

sentences.english: the Spanish flag
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国旗

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

name: cascade
trans: 如瀑布落下,如瀑布下坠

sentences.english: Her thick black hair cascaded down below her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她那浓密的黑发瀑布般垂过腰际。

sentences.english: Gallons of water cascaded over the side of the bath.
sentences.chinese: 大量的水从浴缸边溢出来。

detailed_translations.english: a small steep  waterfall  that is one of several together

detailed_translations.chinese: 像瀑布般大量倾泻下来
detailed_translations.english: to flow, fall, or hang down in large quantities

sentences.english: an ornate gold mirror
sentences.chinese: 华丽的金镜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
detailed_translations.english: covered with a lot of decoration

name: elegant
trans: 优雅的, 文雅的, 雅致的

sentences.english: a tall, elegant young woman
sentences.chinese: 身材高挑、举止优雅的年轻女子

sentences.english: You can dine in elegant surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在雅致的环境中进餐。

detailed_translations.english: beautiful, attractive, or graceful

name: bandwagon
trans: (有越来越多人参与的)大型活动

sentences.english: The keep-fit bandwagon started rolling in the mid-80s.
sentences.chinese: 八十年代中期，健身热潮开始涌现。

detailed_translations.english: an activity that a lot of people are doing

sentences.english: He was a quiet, pious man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个文静、虔诚的人。

detailed_translations.english: having strong religious beliefs, and showing this in the way you behave

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

sentences.english: Tony's coming, do you savvy?
sentences.chinese: 托尼来了，你知道吗?

sentences.english: Children have an innate ability to learn language.
sentences.chinese: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的
detailed_translations.english: an innate quality or ability is something you are born with

sentences.english: There was mockery now in those piercing blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那双敏锐的蓝眼睛里流露出讥讽。

sentences.english: She felt foolish and unsure under his piercing gaze .
sentences.chinese: 在他洞悉一切的注视下，她觉得自己很愚昧，没有自信。

sentences.english: He gave her a piercing look .
sentences.chinese: 他向她投去锐利的目光。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冷得刺骨的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone with piercing eyes is looking at you and seems to know what you are thinking

sentences.english: the maximum permissible level of radiation
sentences.chinese: 允许的最大辐射水平

detailed_translations.english: allowed by law or by the rules

sentences.english: There is a murmur of appreciative laughter.
sentences.chinese: 有一阵低低的赞赏的笑声。

detailed_translations.english: feeling or showing that you enjoy something or are pleased about it

sentences.english: A car of comparable size would cost far more abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同样大小的汽车在国外要贵得多。

detailed_translations.english: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

sentences.english: a telephone pole
sentences.chinese: 电话线杆

detailed_translations.english: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole

name: resemblance
trans: 相似处, 酷肖, 类似

sentences.english: The resemblance between Susan and her sister was remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊和她的姐姐十分相像。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being or looking similar to sb/sth

sentences.english: The wall is weak and requires lateral support.
sentences.chinese: 墙体不坚固，需要从侧面加以支撑。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sides of something, or movement to the side

sentences.english: Scotland has all kinds of happy associations for me.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰给我各种各样愉快的联想。

detailed_translations.english: a relationship with a particular person, organization, group etc

sentences.english: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.english: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.chinese: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.english: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.english: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.chinese: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
detailed_translations.english: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

name: alternative
trans: 供选择的, 可替代的

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: a useful technique for generating new ideas
sentences.chinese: 能产生新创意的有用技术

sentences.english: The program would generate a lot of new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目将创造许多新的就业岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to produce or cause something

sentences.english: There is a certain logic in their choice of architect.
sentences.chinese: 他们对建筑师的选择是有一定道理的。

detailed_translations.english: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟间接导致体重减轻。

sentences.english: The indirect effects of climate change may be profound.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化造成的间接影响可能是深远的。

sentences.english: George’s comments were an indirect way of blaming me.
sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

detailed_translations.english: not directly caused by something

name: technique
trans: 技术, 技巧, 技法, 手段

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.english: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

name: identical
trans: 完全相同的, 完全相似的; 同源的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: notorious
trans: 臭名昭着的; 声名狼藉的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.english: fishing tackle
sentences.chinese: 渔具

detailed_translations.english: to try to deal with a difficult problem
the equipment used in some sports and activities, especially fishing

sentences.english: This diagram will illustrate what I mean.
sentences.chinese: 这个图表可说明我的意思。

sentences.english: This is a simpler diagram than the one I just showed you but the principles are the same.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个比我刚展示的还要更简单的图解，但是原理是一样的。

sentences.english: A table or diagram containing the name and address range of each peripheral addressable by the processor within the memory space.
sentences.chinese: 一个在内存空间中的，包含每个外设的名字和可由处理器设置的地址范围的表格或图表。

detailed_translations.english: to show or represent something in a diagram

detailed_translations.chinese: 图解， 简图， 图表
detailed_translations.english: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

sentences.english: The walls are daubed with graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 墙上满是乱七八糟的涂鸦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 墙上乱写乱画的东西（graffito的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: rude, humorous, or political writing and pictures on the walls of buildings, trains etc

name: visualize
trans: 形象, 想象, 形象化; 想象, 显现

sentences.english: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.chinese: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

sentences.english: Pablo Picasso played a principal role in the early movement of cubism.
sentences.chinese: 帕勃洛•毕加索在立体派早期发展中起首重要的推动作用。

detailed_translations.english: a 20th-century style of art, in which objects and people are represented by  geometric  shapes

sentences.english: He has a tattoo of a snake on his left arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的左臂上刺了一条蛇。

detailed_translations.english: a picture or writing that is permanently marked on your skin using a needle and ink
to mark a permanent picture or writing on someone’s skin with a needle and ink

name: pivotal
trans: 重要的, 关键的, 轴的

sentences.english: The Bank of England has a pivotal role in the London money market.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰银行在伦敦货币市场中起着关键性的作用。

detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else in a situation, system etc

name: Impressionism
trans: 给人以深刻印象的(尤指因巨大 壮观或重要)

sentences.english: Impressionism has long been one of the most popular art movements.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，印象主义一直是最具有影响力的艺术运动之一。

sentences.english: Impressionism has long been one of the most popular art movements.Van Gogh‘s impressionistic paingting entitled "Dr.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，印象主义一直是最具有影响力的艺术运动之一。

detailed_translations.english: Impressionism is a style of painting developed in France between 1870 and 1900 that concentrated on showing the effects of light and colour rather than on clear and exact detail

name: misnomer
trans: 错用名称; 用词错误; 描述失当

sentences.english: ‘Silent movie’ is a misnomer since the movies usually had a musical accompaniment.
sentences.chinese: “无声电影”这一名称不恰当，因为这类电影一般都有配乐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用词不当；误称；写错姓名
detailed_translations.english: a wrong or unsuitable name

sentences.english: We plan to buy some property as an investment.
sentences.chinese: 我们打算买些房地产作为投资。

sentences.english: a huge investment of time and effort
sentences.chinese: 时间和精力的大量投入

detailed_translations.english: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

sentences.english: merger negotiations
sentences.chinese: 合并谈判

detailed_translations.chinese: （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）
detailed_translations.english: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

sentences.english: The money will be used for teacher training schemes.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将用于教师培训计划。

sentences.english: a pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 退休金计划

sentences.english: a get-rich-quick scheme
sentences.chinese: 快速致富的手段

detailed_translations.english: an official plan that is intended to help people in some way, for example by providing education or training

sentences.english: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
sentences.chinese: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

detailed_translations.english: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered

detailed_translations.chinese: 原料，库存品；股本，公债；世系，血统；汤汁；家畜，牲畜
detailed_translations.english: a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add  flavour  to other dishes

sentences.english: ...Japan's four biggest brokerages.
sentences.chinese: …日本的4大经纪公司。

detailed_translations.chinese: 经纪人佣金； 经纪人业务
detailed_translations.english: the business of being a broker

sentences.english: She works for an electronics firm.
sentences.chinese: 她在一家电子公司工作。

detailed_translations.english: a business or company, especially a small one

sentences.english: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
sentences.chinese: 明天天气干燥，间或晴朗。

sentences.english: a double period of Science
sentences.chinese: 一连两节的自然科学课

sentences.english: Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注意标点，特别是逗号和句号的正确使用方法。

detailed_translations.english: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

sentences.english: As a kid he’d never share his toys.
sentences.chinese: 他小时候从不肯与人分享他的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or use something that belongs to you
one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

sentences.english: The committee deferred their decision .
sentences.chinese: 委员会延期作出决定。

detailed_translations.english: to delay something until a later date

sentences.english: You need to prioritize your tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first

sentences.english: As children we were taught to be frugal and hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: He led a remarkably frugal existence.
sentences.chinese: 他过着极其节俭的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
detailed_translations.english: careful to buy only what is necessary

name: surplus
trans: 剩余, 盈余, 过剩

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: frivolous
trans: 轻佻的, 妄动的,琐碎的

sentences.english: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我只是认定自己有点儿太轻率，不适合当医生。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible

sentences.english: Her temperature soared.
sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment
sentences.chinese: 急剧上升的失业率

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

sentences.english: Mr. Thomas was suffering from depression.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯先生当时正受抑郁症折磨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
detailed_translations.english: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

sentences.english: We watched the waves crashing against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着海浪哗啦哗啦地冲击岩石。

sentences.english: The plates went crashing to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 盘子哗啦一声摔落到地上。

sentences.english: A large branch came crashing down .
sentences.chinese: 一根大树枝啪啦一声掉落下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒下，坠落；发出撞击声；垮台，破产
detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone extremely hard while moving, in a way that causes a lot of damage or makes a lot of noise
to have an accident in a car, plane etc by violently hitting something else
a sudden loud noise made by something falling, breaking etc

sentences.english: a munitions factory
sentences.chinese: 兵工厂

detailed_translations.chinese: [军] 军需品（尤指武器弹药）；必需品（munition的复数）
detailed_translations.english: military supplies such as bombs and guns

detailed_translations.chinese: 供应…军需品；从事军需品生产（munition的三单形式）

sentences.english: For a while, she ran a restaurant in Boston.
sentences.chinese: 有一段时间她在波士顿开餐馆。

sentences.english: Many people don’t care who runs the country.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不在乎由谁统治国家。

sentences.english: Courses are currently being run in London and Edinburgh.
sentences.chinese: 目前伦敦和爱丁堡两地都开设了这些课程。

sentences.english: Many people belong to a pension scheme run by their employers.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参加了由雇主管理的养老金计划。

sentences.english: a state-run (= controlled by the government ) television station
sentences.chinese: 国营电视台

detailed_translations.english: to organize or be in charge of an activity, business, organization, or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 奔跑；赛跑；趋向；奔跑的路程
detailed_translations.english: to be very busy and continuously rushing about

sentences.english: Some snakes move with deceptive speed (= move faster than you think or expect ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些蛇的爬行速度出乎意料地快。

sentences.english: Gwen’s students may look angelic, but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 格温的学生也许看起来像天使，不过人不可貌相。

detailed_translations.english: something that is deceptive seems to be one thing but is in fact very different

sentences.english: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
sentences.chinese: 只有我父母作担保，银行才会给我贷款。

sentences.english: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
a formal promise that something will be done

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: syndicate
trans: 辛迪加,企业联合组织, 财团

sentences.english: They formed a syndicate to buy the car in which they competed in the race.
sentences.chinese: 他们合伙买了参加赛车用的那部车。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or companies who join together in order to achieve a particular aim

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合成辛迪加；组成企业联合组织

sentences.english: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
sentences.chinese: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

sentences.english: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他冒了很大的风险任命了他的内阁。

detailed_translations.english: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be

detailed_translations.chinese: 赌博； 投机， 冒险
detailed_translations.english: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people

sentences.english: Deflation is beginning to take hold in the clothing industry.
sentences.chinese: 服装业开始出现通货紧缩。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the amount of money in a country’s  economy  , so that prices fall or stop rising

sentences.english: You need to prioritize your tasks.
sentences.chinese: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

detailed_translations.english: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

name: ruminate
trans: 深思; 沉思; 思索

sentences.english: One is to see whether you have any worry triggers and to distract yourself when you begin to ruminate.
sentences.chinese: 首先看看你自己是否有担忧的动机，如果当你自己出现“沉思”时，尽量分散自己的注意力。

sentences.english: “Some people prone to ruminate have basic problems pushing things out of consciousness once they get there,” she said.
sentences.chinese: 有些人陷入事情中时，倾向于反刍基本问题来把事情驱逐出脑海。

sentences.english: This is in part because real events can affect us in the real world, and in part because we tend to ruminate about the implications of real-world acts.
sentences.chinese: 原因部分是由于真实事件影响着现实世界中的我们，部分是因为我们倾向反复思考现实世界中行为的影响。

detailed_translations.english: to think carefully and deeply about something

sentences.english: You must write in a clear and lucid style.
sentences.chinese: 你的写作风格一定要清楚易懂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 明晰的；透明的；易懂的；头脑清楚的
detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

name: impulsive
trans: 指人或人的行为)凭冲动的, 易冲动的

sentences.english: Rosa was impulsive and sometimes regretted things she’d done.
sentences.chinese: 罗莎性情鲁莽，有时会为做过的事感到后悔。

sentences.english: In a burst of impulsive generosity, I offered to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因一时慷慨，我主动提出付款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲动的；受感情驱使的；任性的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is impulsive does things without considering the possible dangers or problems first

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

sentences.english: feminine intuition
sentences.chinese: 女性的直觉

sentences.english: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.chinese: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直觉； 由直觉获知的信息
detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

sentences.english: The disease originated in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病起源于非洲。

sentences.english: All carbohydrates originate from plants.
sentences.chinese: 所有的碳水化合物均来源于植物。

detailed_translations.english: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist

detailed_translations.chinese: 创造， 创始， 开创
detailed_translations.english: to have the idea for something and start it

sentences.english: seemingly unrelated bits of information
sentences.chinese: 似乎互不相关的零星信息

detailed_translations.english: appearing to have a particular quality, when this may or may not be true

name: marital
trans: 夫的; 妻的; 婚姻的

sentences.english: marital problems
sentences.chinese: 婚姻问题

sentences.english: the increase in marital breakdown
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂的增多

detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

sentences.english: The shortage of teachers was blamed on government cutbacks.
sentences.chinese: 教师短缺归咎于政府削减经费。

sentences.english: A fall in donations has forced the charity to make cutbacks .
sentences.chinese: 捐款减少迫使慈善机构削减开支。

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in something, such as the number of workers in a company or the amount of money a government or company spends

sentences.english: Money is a major cause of strife in many marriages.
sentences.chinese: 钱在许多婚姻中是导致冲突的一个主要原因。

detailed_translations.english: trouble between two or more people or groups

sentences.english: The child’s face was serene and beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子的神情宁静可爱。

sentences.english: a serene mountain lake
sentences.chinese: 静谧的山间湖泊

detailed_translations.chinese: 平静的；安详的；清澈的；晴朗的
detailed_translations.english: very calm or peaceful

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

sentences.english: the most exquisite craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

detailed_translations.chinese: 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful and very delicately made

sentences.english: She’s struggling to cope with the heavy workload .
sentences.chinese: 她在努力应付繁重的工作量。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of work that a person or organization has to do

sentences.english: I’ve had a pretty hectic day.
sentences.chinese: 我忙乱了一整天。

sentences.english: a hectic social life
sentences.chinese: 繁忙的社交生活

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴奋的，狂热的；脸上发红；肺病的；忙碌的
detailed_translations.english: very busy or full of activity

sentences.english: The closure of the export department resulted in over 100 redundancies.
sentences.chinese: 出口部关闭导致一百多人被解雇。

sentences.english: Two thousand workers now face redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 2,000 名工人现在面临失业。

sentences.english: An employee is not eligible for a redundancy payment unless he has been with the company for two years.
sentences.chinese: 在公司工作满两年的雇员才有资格拿遣散费。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计][数] 冗余（等于redundance）；裁员；人浮于事
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone has to leave their job, because they are no longer needed

sentences.english: The mother is usually awarded custody (= legally allowed to have custody ) .
sentences.chinese: 母亲通常会获得监护权。

sentences.english: a dispute over who should have custody of the children
sentences.chinese: 关于孩子监护权归属问题的争执

sentences.english: The couple will retain joint custody (= they will both have custody ) of their daughters.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩将继续保留对女儿的共同监护权。

sentences.english: Allen is fighting a bitter custody battle over his three children.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦为获得自己三个孩子的监护权拼死力争。

detailed_translations.english: the right to take care of a child, given to one of their parents when they have  divorced

sentences.english: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.english: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation

sentences.english: In 1999 it was revealed that he was close to bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 1999年他被披露几近破产。

sentences.english: When inflation rises, so do bankruptcies.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀加剧，破产个案也会增加。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being unable to pay your debts

sentences.english: ...delectable wine.
sentences.chinese: ...美味可口的葡萄酒。

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something, especially food or drink, as delectable, you mean that it is very pleasant

sentences.english: The desire for peace transcended political differences.
sentences.chinese: 对和平的渴望超越了政治分歧。

detailed_translations.english: to go beyond the usual limits of something

name: industrial
trans: 工业的, 与工业有关的

sentences.english: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
sentences.chinese: 到1900年英国已基本进入工业社会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to industry or the people working in it

sentences.english: a campaign of industrial espionage against his main rival
sentences.chinese: 针对他主要竞争对手展开的商业间谍活动

detailed_translations.english: the activity of secretly finding out secret information and giving it to a country’s enemies or a company’s competitors

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

sentences.english: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 从各个方面来看，战争都会是一场灾难。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

sentences.english: These findings have both theoretical and practical applications.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现具有理论和实际的应用。

sentences.english: In this process, an interaction of theoretical study with practical work . should be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，要加强理论的探讨和工作推进的互动作用。

sentences.english: Researchers have tossed around theoretical calculations of using just aluminum and water for rocket propellant in the past.
sentences.chinese: 研究者在过去辗转不安的进行理论计算，仅仅只用铝和水作为火箭燃料。

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

sentences.english: a disgruntled client
sentences.chinese: 不满的客户

detailed_translations.english: annoyed or disappointed, especially because things have not happened in the way that you wanted

name: insider
trans: 内部的人, 会员, 知道内情的人, 权威人士

sentences.english: an insider’s view of the way that a Japanese company works
sentences.chinese: 业内人士对日本公司运作方式的看法

detailed_translations.chinese: 内部的人，会员；熟悉内情者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special knowledge of a particular organization because they are part of it

name: unethical
trans: 无原则的(尤指业务或职业道德方面)

sentences.english: unethical medical practices
sentences.chinese: 不道德的医疗行为

detailed_translations.english: morally unacceptable

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

sentences.english: the fable of the fox and the crow
sentences.chinese: 狐狸和乌鸦的寓言故事

detailed_translations.english: a traditional short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

sentences.english: She uses some wonderful images and metaphors in her writing.
sentences.chinese: 她在作品中用了一些绝妙的比喻和暗喻。

sentences.english: a very creative use of metaphor
sentences.chinese: 隐喻的独到运用

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by referring to it as something different and suggesting that it has similar qualities to that thing

sentences.english: The perfectly formed peak of Mount Fuji is notoriously shy, so any sighting has to be counted as a blessing.
sentences.chinese: 富士山峰造型完美，但是它的害羞却是声名远播，所以任何能看见它的人都似有神助。

sentences.english: Crop circle researcher Andrew Russell, who is investigating the bizarre sighting on behalf of the officer, described the moment his sighting was made.
sentences.chinese: 麦田怪圈研究人员安德鲁·罗素代表这位警官调查他的离奇发现。 他描述了警官当时看到的情形。

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

sentences.english: She had already tried emotional blackmail (=  tried to make him feel guilty  ) to stop him leaving.
sentences.chinese: 她试过以情相迫，不让他离开。

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒索，敲诈；勒索所得之款
detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get money from you or make you do what they want by threatening to tell other people your secrets
to use blackmail against someone

name: improbable
trans: 未必会发生的; 不大可能的

detailed_translations.chinese: 不大可能的, 不像会发生的, 似不可信的

name: implausible
trans: 不像真实的; 难以置信的; 说服不了人的

sentences.english: It’s not entirely implausible that a galaxy could be identical to our own.
sentences.chinese: 某个星系和我们这个星系完全相同并非完全不可能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难以置信的，不像真实的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to believe and therefore unlikely to be true

sentences.english: Plastic replicas of the Greek pottery are sold to gullible tourists.
sentences.chinese: 仿古希腊陶器的塑料复制品被卖给易受骗的游客。

detailed_translations.english: too ready to believe what other people tell you, so that you are easily tricked

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

sentences.english: Potter had argued that the government coerced him into pleading guilty.
sentences.chinese: 波特曾争辩说是政府胁迫他认罪。

detailed_translations.english: to force someone to do something they do not want to do by threatening them

sentences.english: a naive young girl
sentences.chinese: 天真的小女孩

sentences.english: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼稚的； 天真的； 轻信的
detailed_translations.english: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

sentences.english: The greatest occurrence of coronary heart disease is in those over 65.
sentences.chinese: 冠心病的最高发病率在65岁以上的人群中。

sentences.english: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 投诉似乎成了天天发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of something happening

sentences.english: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
sentences.chinese: 持久和平的前景难料。

sentences.english: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful .
sentences.chinese: “一切都会顺顺当当的，你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

detailed_translations.english: probably not true or not likely to happen

sentences.english: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
sentences.chinese: 他逃到河里，甩掉了追踪他的人。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

sentences.english: You're a skeptic.
sentences.chinese: 你是个怀疑论者。

sentences.english: And, most importantly to the skeptic, Jesus did all this in history.
sentences.chinese: 而，最能取信于怀疑者的一点是，耶稣确实在历史上做过这些事情。
